description.narrative: The proposed project aims to improve the water supply system in the country's capital, Dhaka, by making it more reliable, sustainable, and climate-resilient. It will consolidate and enhance the gains made in the efficiency of the water distribution network achieved under two ongoing Asian Development Bank (ADB) projects, and improve the service delivery and the capacity of the Dhaka Water Supply and Sewerage Authority (DWASA).

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Sustainable provision of a more reliable, improved, and climate-resilient supply of water ensured in Dhaka City

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Water supply pressure of at least 1 bar (10 meters) at consumer end achieved (2015 baseline: 0.1-0.5 bar)

description.narrative: Sustainable provision of a more reliable, improved, and climate-resilient supply of water ensured in Dhaka City

title.narrative: Nonrevenue water reduced to below 10 % (2013-2014 baseline: 26%)

description.narrative: Sustainable provision of a more reliable, improved, and climate-resilient supply of water ensured in Dhaka City

title.narrative: 98% of water quality test results within DWASA distribution systems meet country standards (2013 baseline: 90%)

description.narrative: Sustainable provision of a more reliable, improved, and climate-resilient supply of water ensured in Dhaka City

title.narrative: Uninterrupted, 24-hour supply of piped water delivered to 6.5 million people (2015 baseline: intermittent and insufficient supply, 8-10 hours average per day)

description.narrative: Sustainable provision of a more reliable, improved, and climate-resilient supply of water ensured in Dhaka City
